abstract: Japan’s industrial production fell at the fastest rate in at least five years in August, the unemployment rate rose and household spending tumbled, deepening the slump in the country’s economy.
snippet: Japan’s industrial production fell at the fastest rate in at least five years in August, the unemployment rate rose and household spending tumbled, deepening the slump in the country’s economy.
lead_paragraph: Japan’s industrial production fell at the fastest rate in at least five years in August, the unemployment rate rose and household spending tumbled, deepening the slump in the country’s economy. Factory output dropped 3.5 percent from July, the country’s Trade Ministry said. The jobless rate climbed to a two-year high of 4.2 percent, and household spending slumped 4 percent, the most since September 2006, the government said. Japan may already be in a recession as the economic problems in the United States weaken exports and demand at home plummets because of rising prices and the deteriorating labor market. “Japan has one leg in a serious recession,” said Masamichi Adachi, senior economist at JPMorgan Chase in Tokyo. “We have to lower our growth forecasts for Japan this year given today’s numbers.”

abstract: JPMorgan Chase was the world’s biggest underwriter of stocks and bonds in the third quarter, as turmoil in equity and credit markets weighed heavily on new business and on reported fees, Thomson Reuters data show.
lead_paragraph: JPMorgan Chase was the world’s biggest underwriter of stocks and bonds in the third quarter, as turmoil in equity and credit markets weighed heavily on new business and on reported fees, Thomson Reuters data show.

abstract: The Blackstone Group and JPMorgan Chase are teaming to raise over $1 billion to help fund the conversion of 20,000 U.S. cinema screens to digital technology, in a deal due to be announced later on Wednesday, The Financial Times reported.
lead_paragraph: The Blackstone Group and JPMorgan Chase are teaming to raise over $1 billion to help fund the conversion of 20,000 U.S. cinema screens to digital technology, in a deal due to be announced later on Wednesday, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: Blackstone and JPMorgan to Raise $1 Billion for Cinema Deal, Report Says
